message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest scoliosis, and if left untreated, scoliosis can cause a restrictive lung disease due to the curvature of the spine putting pressure on the lungs and restricting breathing. Congestive heart failure and dislocation of the shoulders are not typical complications of scoliosis. Obstructive lung disease may occur in severe cases, but restrictive lung disease is a more common complication.

If left untreated, scoliosis can cause a variety of complications, including restrictive lung disease due to changes in the shape of the chest and pressure on the lungs. Congestive heart failure and dislocation of the shoulders are not typical complications of scoliosis. Obstructive lung disease is not directly caused by scoliosis, although it may occur if the lungs are compressed due to severe curvature of the spine.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The most likely diagnosis is adolescent idiopathic scoliosis (AIS), which can result in progressive spinal deformity and restrictive lung disease if left untreated. Congestive heart failure is not a complication of AIS. Dislocation of the shoulders is not a common complication of AIS, and obstructive lung disease is not a known complication of AIS.
